The bugle is one of the simplest brass instruments, having no valves or other 
pitch-altering devices. All pitch control is done by varying the player's 
embouchure. Consequently, the bugle is limited to notes within the harmonic 
series. See bugle call for scores to standard bugle calls, all consisting of only five
